Title: Litotes
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
Litotes is a figure of speech which emplys an understatement by using double negatives.

Positive statements are expressed by negating its opposite expressions. It is often a useful indirect strategy for reasons of modesty or politeness.

examples:

  • They do not seem the happiest couple around. 
  • Your apartment is not unclean.
  • Štefan Moravčík is not an ordinary man.
